item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "Great Brown Bear is walking with us, Salmon swimming upstream with us, as we stroll a city street." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "With no surroundings there can be no path, and with no path one cannot become free." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description:
"Being the Stream
Meditation is not just a rest or retreat from the turmoil of the stream or the impurity of the world. It is a way of being the stream, so that one can be at home in both the white water and the eddies. Meditation may take one out of the world, but it also puts one totally into it." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "All that we did was human, stupid, easily forgiven, Not quite right." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "Find your place on the planet. Dig in, and take responsibility from there." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "Nature is not a place to visit. It is home." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "You are my best friend as well as my lover, and I do not know which side of you I enjoy the most. I treasure each side, just as I have treasured our life together." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit." -- Aristotle

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Whitney Otto
item.description: "Why are old lovers able to become friends? Two reasons. They never truly loved each other, or they love each other still." -- Whitney Otto

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Why is it," he said, one time, at the subway entrance, "I feel I've known you so many years?" "Because I like you," she said, "and I don't want anything from you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them" -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "So long as we love we serve; so long as we are loved by others, I would almost say that we are indispensable; and no man is useless while he has a friend." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "When the two people who thus discover that they are on the same secret road are of different sexes, the friendship which arises between them will very easily pass – may pass in the first half hour – into erotic love. Indeed, unless they are physically repulsive to each other or unless one or both already loves elsewhere, it is almost certain to do so sooner or later. And conversely, erotic love may lead to Friendship between the lovers. But this, so far from obliterating the distinction between the two loves, puts it in a clearer light. If one who was first, in the deep and full sense, your Friend, is then gradually or suddenly revealed as also your lover you will certainly not want to share the Beloved’s erotic love with any third. But you will have no jealousy at all about sharing the Friendship. Nothing so enriches an erotic love as the discovery that the Beloved can deeply, truly and spontaneously enter into Friendship with the Friends you already had; to feel that not only are we two united by erotic love but we three or four or five are all travelers on the same quest, have all a common vision." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Ali Bin Abi Thalib
item.description: "He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare, And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere. " -- Ali Bin Abi Thalib

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Oliver Wendall Holmes
item.description: "Don't flatter yourself that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. The nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become. Except in cases of necessity, which are rare, leave your friend to learn unpleasant things from his enemies; they are ready enough to tell them." -- Oliver Wendall Holmes

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "A friend may be waiting behind a stranger's face." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Time doesn't take away from friendship, nor does separation." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better." -- Plutarch

item.title: Rochelle add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Some people need a red carpet rolled out in front of them in order to walk forward into friendship. They can't see the tiny outstretched hands all around them, everywhere, like leaves on trees." -- Miranda July
